snippet.textDisplay: Whew, it's been a while since I could freely upload any VGM I want without any self-imposed constraints (a game from the #'s year + Top 10 2016 list)! Woolly World impressed me, but it's the soundtrack that was the highlight. How can you listen to this track and not feel good? I'm sure most of you think the same, but 2017 is off the a crazy start, I don't think I've ever seen this before. I feel like I could make a Top 10 from the first 3 months that are better than any games I played in 2016. I really wish I had more time...
snippet.textOriginal: Whew, it's been a while since I could freely upload any VGM I want without any self-imposed constraints (a game from the #'s year + Top 10 2016 list)! Woolly World impressed me, but it's the soundtrack that was the highlight. How can you listen to this track and not feel good? I'm sure most of you think the same, but 2017 is off the a crazy start, I don't think I've ever seen this before. I feel like I could make a Top 10 from the first 3 months that are better than any games I played in 2016. I really wish I had more time...

snippet.textDisplay: Man its already March. I played the demo of this on my 3DS and fell in love with Clawdaddy Beach, which reminded me of Big Beanvine from Kirby's Epic Yarn. With the line-up we jave now, the soundtracks will rock our ears off. Off to a good start indeed. Onward I say!
snippet.textOriginal: Man its already March. I played the demo of this on my 3DS and fell in love with Clawdaddy Beach, which reminded me of Big Beanvine from Kirby's Epic Yarn. With the line-up we jave now, the soundtracks will rock our ears off. Off to a good start indeed. Onward I say!

snippet.textDisplay: I'm looking forward to seeing BotW on your top 10 list this year. ;)

snippet.textDisplay: Love this game! Usually people are very whiny when it comes to Nintendo, but then sometimes they make something really good, and then you hear nothing from it.
snippet.textOriginal: Love this game! Usually people are very whiny when it comes to Nintendo, but then sometimes they make something really good, and then you hear nothing from it.

snippet.textDisplay:
Nintendo's strategy is not caring. They don't give a Goomba's behind about trends or what anyone thinks of them. They just do their own thing, stick to their formulas, and every so often do something new and unprecedented that blows everyone away.


Activision, Sony, Microsoft, etc.: Nintendo, why can't you see it?! Dark, serious shooters are the future!
Nintendo: No. Dinosaurs. Dinosaurs made out of YARN.
Activision: Idiot! People prefer Call of Duty and games like it.
Nintendo: Mario. Link. Final Fantasy. Pokemon. FRICKING. KIRBY. Your grimdark soldiers have been defeated by all of them.
Microsoft: Your graphics can't hold a candle to ours! My Xboxes blow you out of the water!
Sony: Even the PS3 will look good years from now, to say nothing of the PS4, but you're still stuck in the past! The Wii's graphics made me want to hurl! It's a piece of cr@p!
Nintendo: <goes into super-mode> The Xbox 360 and the PS3 sold over 80 million units each. My "piece of cr@p" sold 102 million, and kept selling for five years longer than either of you. Yeah, the PS1, the PS2 and the original Xbox had me beat - but HELLO?! Game Boys? DSs? SNES? NES? History remembers me as the company that singlehandedly brought the industry out of the Crash of '83! Like it or not, you all owe your existence to me - and no matter what you do, you can never take that away. And you know what else you can't take away from me? People will always want to be happy. So that's what I give them, and look where it's gotten me.
Everyone else: ...
Nintendo: <returns to normal> Heeeyyyy... maybe I could make KIRBY be made out of yarn!
snippet.textOriginal:
Nintendo's strategy is not caring. They don't give a Goomba's behind about trends or what anyone thinks of them. They just do their own thing, stick to their formulas, and every so often do something new and unprecedented that blows everyone away.


Activision, Sony, Microsoft, etc.: Nintendo, why can't you see it?! Dark, serious shooters are the future!
Nintendo: No. Dinosaurs. Dinosaurs made out of YARN.
Activision: Idiot! People prefer Call of Duty and games like it.
Nintendo: Mario. Link. Final Fantasy. Pokemon. FRICKING. KIRBY. Your grimdark soldiers have been defeated by all of them.
Microsoft: Your graphics can't hold a candle to ours! My Xboxes blow you out of the water!
Sony: Even the PS3 will look good years from now, to say nothing of the PS4, but you're still stuck in the past! The Wii's graphics made me want to hurl! It's a piece of cr@p!
Nintendo: <goes into super-mode> The Xbox 360 and the PS3 sold over 80 million units each. My "piece of cr@p" sold 102 million, and kept selling for five years longer than either of you. Yeah, the PS1, the PS2 and the original Xbox had me beat - but HELLO?! Game Boys? DSs? SNES? NES? History remembers me as the company that singlehandedly brought the industry out of the Crash of '83! Like it or not, you all owe your existence to me - and no matter what you do, you can never take that away. And you know what else you can't take away from me? People will always want to be happy. So that's what I give them, and look where it's gotten me.
Everyone else: ...
Nintendo: <returns to normal> Heeeyyyy... maybe I could make KIRBY be made out of yarn!
